description: {"blocks":[{"key":"desaj","text":"With the oncoming age of big data, biologists are encountering more use cases for cloud-based computing to streamline data processing and storage. Unfortunately, cloud platforms are difficult to learn, and there are few resources geared towards biologists for demystifying them. We have developed a guide for experimental biologists to set up cloud processing on Amazon Web Services to cheaply outsource data processing and storage. Here we provide a guide on setting up a computing environment in the cloud and showcase examples of using Python and Julia programming languages. We present example calcium imaging data in the zebrafish brain and corresponding analysis using suite2p software. Tools for management of users and budgets are discussed in the protocol. Following this guide should help researchers even with limited programming experience to get started or move existing coding infrastructure into the cloud environment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apf7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"iuas","text":"The last step in this version contains a supplemental video with extra context and tips, as part of the protocols.io Spotlight series, featuring conversations with protocol authors.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AA9D0A665F1211EE955C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/steps-for-setup-of-aws-organization-s3-data-storag-c2sayeae?step=34"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fbq6j","text":"We consulted two tutorials to set up computing instances:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93fss","text":"By Justin Bois, the AWS setup and usage lesson in his Caltech BE/Bi 103b class \"Statistical Inference in the Biological Sciences\" https://bebi103b.github.io/lessons/08/aws_setup.html","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":130,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":130,"length":52}],"data":{}},{"key":"5amnf","text":"By Chris Albon: Run Project Jupyter Notebooks On Amazon EC2","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":16,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":16,"length":43}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"AEF26CCC2D0B11ECA5730A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://bebi103b.github.io/lessons/08/aws_setup.html"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"AEF26D1F2D0B11ECA5730A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://chrisalbon.com/code/aws/basics/run_project_jupyter_on_amazon_ec2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"201ef","text":"Find a new instance image (operating system) from the AWS marketplace, either Amazon Linux 2, or Ubuntu 18.04 or 20.04.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5umd1","text":"We recommend using Amazon Linux 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2utb5","text":"On the Launch page, in the dropdown Choose Action menu, choose Launch through EC2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s1vf","text":"  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"245931982D0C11ECA5730A58A9FEAC02","height":"250","is_video":false,"mime":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/vYzmaouTOd7SSq4p-OLQbVkwEvPCXUWG6rdE-G0sOPHZfFwpCvJSRrPc0DwQtMHIjbWrDbR3SPptNVgkIOLSsdeFHGqdeF4l3Ts_Hc8s1w0-IEvbr76EkKdnTOkLWgTC5d26PLI=s0","source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/vYzmaouTOd7SSq4p-OLQbVkwEvPCXUWG6rdE-G0sOPHZfFwpCvJSRrPc0DwQtMHIjbWrDbR3SPptNVgkIOLSsdeFHGqdeF4l3Ts_Hc8s1w0-IEvbr76EkKdnTOkLWgTC5d26PLI=s0","width":"443"}},"1":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"272DD4222D0C11ECA5730A58A9FEAC02","height":"250","is_video":false,"mime":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/vYzmaouTOd7SSq4p-OLQbVkwEvPCXUWG6rdE-G0sOPHZfFwpCvJSRrPc0DwQtMHIjbWrDbR3SPptNVgkIOLSsdeFHGqdeF4l3Ts_Hc8s1w0-IEvbr76EkKdnTOkLWgTC5d26PLI=s0","source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/vYzmaouTOd7SSq4p-OLQbVkwEvPCXUWG6rdE-G0sOPHZfFwpCvJSRrPc0DwQtMHIjbWrDbR3SPptNVgkIOLSsdeFHGqdeF4l3Ts_Hc8s1w0-IEvbr76EkKdnTOkLWgTC5d26PLI=s0","width":"443"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejikh","text":"This will open a Launch wizard. In the Launch Instance wizard, you will be brought through a 5 part launch sequence.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2sr9","text":"Choose Instance Type. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qr2r","text":"This will configure your virtual machine \"hardware\" such as memory size and CPU.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53gbb","text":"Some relevant parameters here are memory size (RAM), number of cores, and internet speed. For most applications, RAM should be at least 32 GB, the number of cores should be at least 8, and the internet should be very fast, especially because we will be streaming tens or even hundreds of GB of data from S3 to EC2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ui7","text":"  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"483609982D0C11ECA5730A58A9FEAC02","height":"203","is_video":false,"mime":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/_OIt0V293TftpI9efJJMfo6EzAZ9Ogwh7tlzP_SrfOs_IAg1x4C3dS5G2f4TWdAXmZvbJBnfBU2Foz1NhjPHscnolZiBizXXKcMULBNMH5p1tGRsvd8_zc-esd19fz09G-rHZBg=s0","source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/_OIt0V293TftpI9efJJMfo6EzAZ9Ogwh7tlzP_SrfOs_IAg1x4C3dS5G2f4TWdAXmZvbJBnfBU2Foz1NhjPHscnolZiBizXXKcMULBNMH5p1tGRsvd8_zc-esd19fz09G-rHZBg=s0","width":"446"}},"1":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"4C05CAB92D0C11ECA5730A58A9FEAC02","height":"203","is_video":false,"mime":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/_OIt0V293TftpI9efJJMfo6EzAZ9Ogwh7tlzP_SrfOs_IAg1x4C3dS5G2f4TWdAXmZvbJBnfBU2Foz1NhjPHscnolZiBizXXKcMULBNMH5p1tGRsvd8_zc-esd19fz09G-rHZBg=s0","source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/_OIt0V293TftpI9efJJMfo6EzAZ9Ogwh7tlzP_SrfOs_IAg1x4C3dS5G2f4TWdAXmZvbJBnfBU2Foz1NhjPHscnolZiBizXXKcMULBNMH5p1tGRsvd8_zc-esd19fz09G-rHZBg=s0","width":"446"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1q","text":"Add Storage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8famq","text":"This local storage is fast but will be destroyed after you terminate instance. To start, give your instance around 3x the size of your current dataset. This provides very fast \"local\" storage to the instance (compared to slower S3 storage)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: EC2: Connecting to and using your instance
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eibo8","text":"If you have just created the instance, it will start automatically. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o3qq","text":"If the instance has been \"Stopped\", start your instance. Process should take less than few minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70f5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v9kc","text":"NB: at the end of the work with the instance, you can either Stop or Terminate instance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edb3b","text":"Stopped instance will have all its memory saved in S3 storage (and you will be billed for every GB of stored data according to S3 prices). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnfns","text":"We recommend stopping instances at the end of work.
